title: Ukranian forces may retreat from beset Bakhmut
description: Analysts say the fall of Bakhmut would be a blow for Ukraine and offer tactical advantages to Russia, but would not prove decisive to the war's outcome.

title: Macron arrives in Gabon as he begins tour of Central Africa
description: Macron's trip comes as alarm grows in Paris over Russia's rising influence in French-speaking African countries, joining China, which has been present in the region for some years.

title: 'Empire of Light': Sam Mendes' ode to the consoling power of cinema
description: The filmmaker harks back to his youth in 1970s England in his new film, in which Olivia Colman and Michael Ward make an original and unlikely pair.

title: In the United States, the legal case embarrassing Fox News
description: The media tycoon Rupert Murdoch admitted under oath that several of its network's star anchors had endorsed lies about electoral fraud put forward by Donald Trump's supporters in 2020.

title: Finland's Parliament gives final approval for NATO bid
description: Lawmakers voted 184-7 in support of Finland's NATO accession, in the country's first deviation from a historical policy of non-alignment since World War II.

title: How two intertwined companies dominate the paper market
description: The Canadian company Paper Excellence, owner of two pulp mills in France, is controlled by Indonesia's Asia Pulp and Paper, whose environmental practices are questionable, according to a vast investigation of which 'Le Monde' is a partner.

title: Iranian president orders probe of poisoning at girls' schools
description: Hundreds of girls at around 30 schools have been sickened since November in what officials suspect are attacks targeting women's education.

title: EU Parliament bans TikTok on work devices
description: The move was based on data protection concerns and follows similar moves by the European Commission and the European Council.

title: Astronomers learn from first asteroid deflection test
description: The device, which struck Dimorphos, was more effective than researchers thought it would be. They were able to study the surface of the asteroid.

title: China increases influence in Solomon Islands after leader ousted
description: The dismissal of Daniel Suidani, former PM of the main island, removes one of the main voices critical of China in a country previously close to Taiwan.

title: Compared to the UK, Switzerland remains a relatively safe haven for Russian oligarchs
description: As the two main hubs for billionaires close to the Kremlin like Viktor Rachnikov and Oleg Deripaska, London and Berne are not applying sanctions to Russia equally.

title: Greek transport minister resigns over deadly train crash
description: At least 36 people died and dozens were injured in the coalition involving two trains in central Greece.

title: A rough start for the European 'Belt and Road Initiative'
description: On March 1, the 27 EU Member States are expected to adopt an initial list of 87 projects, located around the world, that will benefit from this community initiative, which was originally presented at the end of 2021.

title: Turkey earthquake survivors are bitter about the government's takeover of aid
description: In southeastern Pazarcik, NGOs and opposition parties, faced with the lack of reaction from the authorities, organized support for survivors but have since been driven away.

title: One villa seized and 17 investigations opened: French sanctions against Russian oligarchs begin to bear fruit
description: Since the invasion of Ukraine, the French justice system has opened at least 17 criminal investigations aimed at confiscating Russian elites' assets.

title: Waiting for Western tanks, Ukrainian soldiers train rapidly in order to go 'straight into battle'
description: With up to 140 tanks expected, Ukrainian crews have begun training on equipment that is much more modern than the Russian tanks currently in use.

title: US top diplomat Blinken says 'no plans' to meet Russia, China at G20
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Sergey Lavrov last met individually in January 2022 in Geneva.

title: The death of Just Fontaine, a French football legend and World Cup record holder
description: The football player scored 13 goals in the 1958 World Cup, a record still unbroken. He died on Wednesday, aged 89.

title: China accuses US of hurting its credibility over 'lab leak' claims
description: A report earlier this week said the US Department of Energy had determined that a leak from a Chinese lab was the most likely cause of the Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell appeals to overturn sex-crimes conviction
description: Maxwell's lawyers argued she was denied a fair trial and used as a scapegoat because Jeffrey Epstein evaded justice.

title: France does not set a target for reducing pesticide use by 2030
description: The government's Ecophyto 2030 plan sets out to coordinate France's target against pesticide use in agriculture with that of the European Union.

title: French government refrains from adopting tough measures on drought... for now
description: The government is calling on local authorities to issue restriction orders on water use well ahead of the summer as an unprecedented winter drought is hitting the country.

title: 'TotalEnergies' projects in Uganda are a threat to planetary health'
description: Director and writer Marie-Monique Robin and environmentalist Serge Morand write that the roads being cut through fragile ecosystems and oil well drilling could lead to the emergence of new infectious outbreaks

title: 'We need a miracle': In Bakhmut, Ukrainian soldiers desperately try to hold off the Russian advance
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky said the situation in the city is 'the greatest difficulty' for the Ukrainian army, which now controls only a narrow corridor to enter and leave.

title: France spent €634 million on hosting Ukrainians in 2022
description: A report by France's audit office highlighted the responsiveness of public authorities. Paris spent about twice as much on Ukrainian refugees compared to 'classic' asylum seekers.

title: Chicago mayoral election: Incumbent ousted as race goes to runoff
description: Mayor Lori Lightfoot wasn't able to garner enough support to win a second term in the third-largest US city.

title: In Iran, uranium particles enriched to nearly bomb grade
description: According to a report by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), particles of uranium enriched to 83.7 percent were detected in Iran, just under the 90 percent needed to produce an atomic bomb.

title: French pension reform: Why comparing European systems is hardly relevant
description: French politicians are quick to cite their European neighbors to help prove their point. But pension systems are so complex and different that comparing them is rarely feasible.

title: Elly Schlein, the new face of Italy's center-left
description: At 37, Schlein is the first woman to be elected head of the Democratic Party and presents herself as the antithesis of far-right leader Giorgia Meloni.

title: Russian diamonds continue to European sanctions to Belgium's delight
description: On February 24, the European Commission adopted a new set of sanctions against Russia. Once again Antwerp, a global hub for precious stones, has been spared.

title: Conservative Supreme Court appears skeptical of Biden's plan to cancel student debt
description: In a hearing at the Supreme Court, conservative justices holding the majority appeared ready to sink President Joe Biden's plan to wipe away or reduce student loans held by millions of Americans.

title: Train wreck in Greece kills 16, injures at least 85
description: A major emergency response was launched after the fiery collision between a freight train and a passenger train carrying 350 passengers.

title: Paris is transforming rather than demolishing its buildings
description: An exhibition at the Pavillon de l'Arsenal illustrates the current trend in architecture to transform what exists already rather than building new. This will be the case for several buildings in Paris that have lost their original purpose.
